intro: Pedicularis chihuahuensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange, often resembling small, delicate orchids. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
